monster.name: Tarrasque - a5e
monster.save: Str 19, Dex 10, Con 19, Int 6, Wis 11, Cha 11
monster.immune: fire, poison; damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.senses: blindsight 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 12

trait.name: Astounding Leap
trait.text: The tarrasques high jump distance is equal to its Speed.

trait.name: Bloodied Regeneration
trait.text: While the tarrasque is bloodied, it regains 50 hit points at the start of each of its turns. A wish spell can suppress this trait for 24 hours. The tarrasque dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesnt regenerate.

trait.name: Immortal Nature
trait.text: The tarrasque doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
trait.text: When the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 3, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 4 to 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the spell is reflected back, targeting the caster as if it originated from the tarrasque.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tarrasque attacks with its bite claw horns and tail. It can use Swallow instead of its bite. If its bloodied it also recharges and then uses Radiant Breath.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 42 (5d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it is grappled (escape DC 27). Until this grapple ends the target is restrained and the tarrasque can't bite a different creature.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit reach 15 ft. one target. Hit: 32 (5d8 + 10) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 37 (5d10 + 10) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit reach 20 ft. one target. Hit: 27 (5d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature it falls prone.

action.name: Swallow
action.text: The tarrasque makes a bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits the target is swallowed and the grapple ends. A swallowed creature has total cover from attacks from outside the tarrasque it is blinded and restrained and it takes 35 (10d6) acid damage and 35 (10d6) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the tarrasques turns.

action.name: If a swallowed creature deals 70 or more damage to the tarrasque in a single turn, or if the tarrasque dies, the tarrasque vomits up all swallowed creatures
Radiant Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The tarrasque exhales radiant energy in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a DC 27 Constitution saving throw taking 105 (30d6) radiant damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

legendary.name: The tarrasque can take 3 legendary actions
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Attack
legendary.text: The tarrasque attacks with its claw or tail.

legendary.name: Move
legendary.text: The tarrasque moves up to half its Speed.

legendary.name: Roar
legendary.text: Each creature of the tarrasques choice within 120 feet makes a DC 19 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it is frightened for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is in line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If it succeeds on a saving throw or the effect ends on it, it is immune to the tarrasques Roar for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Elite Recovery (While Bloodied)
legendary.text: The tarrasque ends one negative effect currently affecting it. It can use this action as long as it has at least 1 hit point, even while unconscious or incapacitated.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The tarrasque makes a bite attack or uses Swallow.

legendary.name: Inescapable Earth (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary.text: Each flying creature or object within 300 feet falls and its flying speed is reduced to 0 until the start of the tarrasques next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The thug attacks twice with their brass knuckles.

action.name: Brass Knuckles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points it is unconscious and stable.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit range 100/400 feet one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Thugs are tough street brawlers, as deadly with their fists as with weapons
action.text: Thieves guilds and villainous nobles employ thugs to collect money and exert power. Merchants and nobles hire thugs to guard warehouses and shops.

trait.name: Storm Sight
trait.text: A thunderbirds vision is not limited by weather.

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) piercing damage.

Until this grapple ends the griffon can't attack a different target with its talons.

action.name: Lightning Strike (Recharge 6)
action.text: The thunderbird exhales a blast of lightning at one target within 60 feet. The target makes a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage on a failure or half the damage on a success.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The tiger has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
trait.text: If the dragon turtle fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, the faint glow cast by its shell winks out. When the dragon turtle uses Retract, it gains one more use of this ability and its shell regains its luminescence.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragon turtles spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 17). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: 3/day each: control weather, water breathing, zone of truth

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 15 ft. one target. Hit: 52 (7d12 + 7) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it is grappled (escape DC 21). Until this grapple ends the dragon turtle can't bite a different creature and it has advantage on bite attacks against the grappled creature.

action.name: Ram
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 15 ft. one target. Hit: 46 (6d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. This attack deals double damage against objects vehicles and constructs.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 15 ft. one target. Hit: 46 (6d12 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature it makes a DC 21 Strength saving throw. On a failure it is pushed 15 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

action.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon turtle exhales steam in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 20 Constitution saving throw taking 52 (15d6) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Lightning Storm (1/Day)
action.text: Hundreds of arcs of lightning crackle from the dragon turtle. Each creature within 90 feet makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw taking 35 (10d6) lightning damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

reaction.name: Retract
reaction.text: When the dragon turtle takes 50 damage or more from a single attack or spell, it retracts its head and limbs into its shell. It immediately regains 20 hit points. While retracted, it is blinded; its Speed is 0; it can't take reactions; it has advantage on saving throws; attacks against it have disadvantage; and it has resistance to all damage. The dragon turtle stays retracted until the beginning of its next turn.

reaction.name: Tail
reaction.text: When the dragon turtle is hit by an opportunity attack, it makes a tail attack.

reaction.name: Claws
reaction.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (4d8 + 7) slashing damage.

legendary.name: The dragon turtle can take 3 legendary actions
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Claw Kick
legendary.text: The dragon turtle makes a claws attack and then moves up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Emerald Radiance (1/Day)
legendary.text: Searing green light emanates from the dragon turtle. Each creature within 90 feet makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 (20d6) radiant damage on a failure or half damage on a success. A creature that fails the saving throw is blinded until the end of its next turn.

legendary.name: Lightning Storm (1/Day
legendary.text: The dragon turtle recharges and uses Lightning Storm.

legendary.name: Tail (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The dragon turtle makes a tail attack.

trait.text: The kraken doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: If the kraken fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it can use its reaction, if available, to attack with its tentacle.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The kraken has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Bloodied Ichor
trait.text: While the Kraken is bloodied and in the water, black ichor leaks from it in a 60-foot radius, spreading around corners but not leaving the water. The area is lightly obscured to all creatures except the Kraken. A creature that starts its turn in the area takes 10 (3d6) acid damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 36 (4d12 + 10) piercing damage. If the target is a Huge or smaller creature grappled by the kraken the target is swallowed. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained its Speed is 0 it has total cover from attacks from outside the kraken and it takes 42 (12d6) acid damage at the start of each of the krakens turns.

action.name: If a swallowed creature deals 50 or more damage to the kraken in a single turn, or if the kraken dies, the kraken vomits up the creature
Ink Cloud
action.text: While underwater the kraken exudes a cloud of ink in a 90-foot-radius sphere. The ink extends around corners and the area is heavily obscured until the end of the krakens next turn or until a strong current dissipates the cloud. Each non-kraken creature in the area when the cloud appears makes a DC 24 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it takes 27 (5d10) poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a success it takes half damage. A poisoned creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Summon Storm (1/Day)
action.text: Over the next 10 minutes storm clouds magically gather. At the end of 10 minutes a storm rages for 1 hour in a 5-mile radius.

action.name: Lightning (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: If the kraken is outside and the weather is stormy three lightning bolts crack down from the sky each of which strikes a different target within 120 feet of the kraken. A target makes a DC 24 Dexterity saving throw taking 28 (8d6) lightning damage or half damage on a save.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +18 to hit reach 30 ft. one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 26). Until this grapple ends the target is restrained. A tentacle can be targeted individually by an attack. It shares the krakens hit points but if 30 damage is dealt to the tentacle it releases a creature it is grappling. The kraken can grapple up to 10 creatures.

action.name: Fling
action.text: One Large or smaller object or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a straight line. The target lands prone and takes 21 (6d6) bludgeoning damage. If the kraken throws the target at another creature that creature makes a DC 26 saving throw taking the same damage on a failure.

legendary.name: The kraken can take 3 legendary actions
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Tentacle
legendary.text: The kraken makes one tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Fling
legendary.text: The kraken uses Fling.

legendary.name: Squeeze (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The kraken ends any magical effect that is restraining it or reducing its movement and then swims up to half its swim speed without provoking opportunity attacks. During this movement, it can fit through gaps as narrow as 10 feet wide without squeezing.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, the treant is indistinguishable from a tree.

trait.name: Flammable
trait.text: If the treant takes fire damage, it catches fire, taking 10 (3d6) ongoing fire damage, unless it is already on fire. It can use an action to extinguish itself, ending the ongoing damage.

trait.name: Forest Speaker
trait.text: The treant can communicate with beasts and plants.

trait.name: Siege Monster
trait.text: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The treant makes two attacks or makes one attack and uses Animate Plant.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 20 (4d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit range 60/180 ft. one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Plant
action.text: The treant magically animates a Large or larger plant within 60 feet. The plant is immobile but it acts on the treants initiative and can make slam attacks or rock attacks if there are rocks to throw within 10 feet of it. Non-plant creatures treat the ground within 15 feet of the plant as difficult terrain as surrounding roots conspire to trip and grasp moving creatures. The plant remains animated for 1 hour. If the treant uses this action while it has three plants animated in this way the plant that has been animated the longest returns to normal.

action.name: Defensive Gore
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 24 (3d12 + 5) piercing damage and the target has disadvantage on the next attack it makes against the triceratops before the end of the triceratopss next turn.

action.name: Trample
action.text: The triceratops moves up to its speed in a straight line. It can move through the spaces of Large and smaller creatures. Each of these creatures makes a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw taking 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage on a failure.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The priest is a 5th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13 +5 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following cleric spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): sacred flame thaumaturgy minor illusion 1st-level (4 slots): ceremony detect evil and good healing word disguise self 2nd-level (3 slots): lesser restoration invisibility 3rd-level (2 slots): spirit guardians major image

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the priest can expend a spell slot to deal 7 (2d6) radiant damage plus an extra 3 (1d6) radiant damage for each level of the spell slot expended above 1st.

action.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip; V, S)
action.text: One creature the priest can see within 60 feet makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw taking 9 (2d8) radiant damage on a failure. This spell ignores cover.

action.name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, M, Concentration)
action.text: The priest or a creature they touch is invisible for 1 hour. The spell ends if the invisible creature attacks or casts a spell.

action.name: Spirit Guardians (3rd-Level; V, S, M, Concentration)
action.text: Spectral forms surround the priest in a 10-foot radius for 10 minutes. The priest can choose creatures they can see to be unaffected by the spell. Other creatures treat the area as difficult terrain and when a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there it makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw taking 10 (3d6) radiant or necrotic damage (priests choice) on a failure or half damage on a success.

trait.name: Stench
trait.text: A non-troglodyte that starts its turn within 5 feet of the troglodyte makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature is immune to a troglodytes Stench for 24 hours.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the troglodyte has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troglodyte attacks with its bite and its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage and the target makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it is infected with Troglodyte Stench.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Dart
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit range 20/60 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) poison damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The troll has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesnt function on its next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesnt regenerate.

trait.name: Severed Limbs
trait.text: If the troll is dealt a critical hit with a slashing weapon, one of its extremities is severed. The extremity has AC 15, 10 hit points, a Speed of 10, and the trolls Regeneration trait. The troll controls the severed extremity and perceives through it with the appropriate senses (for instance, it sees through the eyes of its severed head). As a bonus action, the troll can reattach the extremity. While the troll is missing the extremity, its maximum hit points are reduced by 10. Roll d6 to determine the severed extremity:

trait.name: 1-4: Arm
trait.text: If the troll has an arm, it loses an arm. It loses one of its claw attacks, and the severed arm can make a claw attack.

trait.name: 5-6: Head
trait.text: If the troll has a head, it loses its head. It loses its bite attack, and the severed head can make a bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The troll attacks with its bite and twice with its claw.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The tyrannosaurus makes a bite attack and a tail attack against two different targets.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends the tyrannosaurus can't bite a different creature and it has advantage on bite attacks against the grappled creature.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Good
trait.text: The unicorn radiates a Good aura.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The unicorns innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: animal messenger, detect evil and good, druidcraft, pass without trace, scrying (locations within its domain only), 1/day: calm emotions, dispel evil and good, teleport (between locations within its domain only)

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The unicorn attacks once with its hooves and once with its horn.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) radiant damage. If the target is a creature and the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and makes a DC 16 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

action.name: Grant Boon (3/Day)
action.text: The unicorn touches a willing creature including itself with its horn and grants one of the following boons:

action.name: Healing: The creature magically regains 21 (6d6) hit points
action.text: It is cured of all diseases and poisons affecting it are neutralized.

action.name: Luck: During the next 24 hours, the creature can roll a d12 and add the result to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw after seeing the result
Protection: A glowing mote of light orbits the creatures head
action.text: The mote lasts 24 hours. When the creature fails a saving throw it can use its reaction to expend the mote and succeed on the saving throw.

action.name: Resolution: The creature is immune to being charmed or frightened for 24 hours

monster.name: Ur-Otyugh - a5e
monster.languages: telepathy 120 ft. (can transmit but not receive thoughts and images)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
trait.text: If the ur-otyugh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it becomes more sluggish. Each time the ur-otyugh uses Legendary Resistance, its Speed and swim speed decrease by 10 and it loses one of its legendary actions on each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The otyugh makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is grappled (escape DC 14) and restrained until the grapple ends. The otyugh has two tentacles each of which can grapple one target and can't attack a different target while doing so.

action.name: Tentacle Slam
action.text: The otyugh slams any creatures it is grappling into a hard surface or into each other. Each creature makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw. On a failure the target takes 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage is stunned until the end of the otyughs next turn and is pulled up to 5 feet towards the otyugh. On a success the target takes half damage.

legendary.name: The ur-otyugh can take 2 legendary actions
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Mad Dash
legendary.text: The ur-otyugh moves up to half its Speed.

legendary.name: Tentacle
legendary.text: The ur-otyugh makes a tentacle attack. This attack has a range of 15 feet.

legendary.name: Mental Fuzz (Costs 2 Actions
legendary.text: The ur-otyugh transmits a burst of psionic static. Each non-aberration within 30 feet makes a DC 14 Intelligence saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 14 (4d6) psychic damage and is stunned until the end of the ur-otyughs next turn. On a success, the creature takes half damage.

monster.name: Vampire - a5e
monster.resist: necrotic; damage from nonmagical, non-silvered weapons
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: When the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it visibly grows older. Its original appearance is restored when it finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Misty Recovery
trait.text: When the vampire drops to 0 hit points, instead of falling unconscious, it turns into mist as if it had used the Mist Form legendary action. It can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to vampire form and is paralyzed for 1 hour, at which time it regains 1 hit point. While paralyzed in this way, it can be destroyed by fire damage, radiant damage, damage from a magical weapon, or a wooden stake driven through the heart, but it is otherwise immune to damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and hasnt taken radiant damage since its last turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The vampire can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
trait.text: Vampires most common weaknesses are sunlight and running water. When the vampire ends its turn in contact with one of its weaknesses (such as being bathed in sunlight or running water), it takes 20 radiant damage. While in contact with its weakness, it can't use its Regeneration trait or its Mist Form or Shapechange actions.

trait.name: Resting Place
trait.text: Every vampires lair contains a resting place, usually a coffin or sarcophagus, where the vampire must rest for at least an hour each day to recuperate its powers. This resting place is sprinkled with soil from its mortal homeland. If this soil is scattered or is subjected to a bless, hallow, or similar spell, the vampire is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.

action.name: Grab (Vampire Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 17) and restrained while grappled in this way.

action.name: Charm
action.text: The vampire targets a creature within 30 feet forcing it to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the target is charmed by the vampire for 24 hours. While charmed it regards the vampire as a trusted friend and is a willing target for the vampires bite. The target repeats the saving throw each time it takes damage ending the effect on itself on a success. If the targets saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it it is immune to this vampires Charm for 24 hours.

reaction.name: Hissing Scuttle (1/Day)
reaction.text: When the vampire takes radiant damage, it moves up to its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Warding Charm (1/Day)
reaction.text: When a creature the vampire can see targets it with a melee attack but before the attack is made, the vampire uses Charm on that creature.

reaction.name: Bite
reaction.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target that is grappled, incapacitated, restrained, willing, or unaware of the vampires presence. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. The targets hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and the vampire regains this number of hit points. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, it dies and rises the following night as a vampire spawn in the vampires thrall. Before the target first rises as a vampire spawn, a bless, gentle repose, or similar spell cast on the body prevents this transformation.

legendary.name: The vampire can take 1 legendary action
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Blood Charm
legendary.text: The vampire uses Charm. A creature makes its initial saving throw with disadvantage if the vampire has hit it with a bite attack within the last 24 hours.

legendary.name: Grab
legendary.text: The vampire makes a grab attack.

legendary.name: Mist Form
legendary.text: The vampire transforms into a mist or back into its true form. As mist, the vampire has a flying speed of 30, can't speak, can't take actions or manipulate objects, is immune to nonmagical damage from weapons, and has advantage on saving throws and Stealth checks. It can pass through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing but can't pass through water. Anything its carrying transforms with it.

legendary.name: Shapechange
legendary.text: The vampire transforms into the shape of a Medium or smaller beast or back into its true form. While transformed, it has the beasts size and movement modes. It can't use reactions or legendary actions, and can't speak. Otherwise, it uses the vampires statistics. Anything its carrying transforms with it.

monster.name: Vampire Assassin - a5e
monster.resist: necrotic; damage from nonmagical, non-silvered weapons
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: When the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it visibly grows older. Its original appearance is restored when it finishes a long rest.

While paralyzed in this way, it can be destroyed by fire damage, radiant damage, damage from a magical weapon, or a wooden stake driven through the heart, but it is otherwise immune to damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and hasnt taken radiant damage since its last turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The vampire can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.text: Vampires most common weaknesses are sunlight and running water. When the vampire ends its turn in contact with one of its weaknesses (such as being bathed in sunlight or running water), it takes 20 radiant damage. While in contact with its weakness, it can't use its Regeneration trait or its Mist Form or Shapechange actions.

This resting place is sprinkled with soil from its mortal homeland. If this soil is scattered or is subjected to a bless, hallow, or similar spell, the vampire is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.

trait.name: Misty Stealth
trait.text: While in Mist Form in dim light or darkness, the vampire is invisible.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
trait.text: The vampire deals an extra 10 (3d6) damage when it hits with a weapon attack while it has advantage on the attack, or when its target is within 5 feet of an ally of the vampire while the vampire doesnt have disadvantage on the attack.

action.name: Grab (Vampire Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 17) and restrained while grappled in this way.

monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.text: The vampire is a 7th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 15). It has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): mage hand minor illusion 1st-level (4 slots): disguise self shield 2nd-level (3 slots): darkness misty step 3rd-level (3 slots): animate dead fireball 4th-level (1 slot): blight

action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 17) and restrained while grappled in this way.

action.name: Fireball (3rd-Level; V, S, M)
action.text: Fire streaks from the vampire to a point within 120 feet and explodes in a 20-foot radius spreading around corners. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw taking 21 (6d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

action.name: Blight (4th-Level; V, S)
action.text: The vampire targets a living creature or plant within 30 feet draining moisture and vitality from it. The target makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw taking 36 (8d8) necrotic damage on a failure or half damage on a success. Plant creatures have disadvantage on their saving throw and take maximum damage. A nonmagical plant dies.

reaction.name: Hissing Scuttle (1/Day)
reaction.text: When the vampire takes radiant damage, it moves up to its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Warding Charm (1/Day)
reaction.text: When a creature the vampire can see targets it with a melee attack but before the attack is made, the vampire uses Charm on that creature.

reaction.name: Shield (1st-Level; V
reaction.text: When the vampire is hit by an attack or targeted by magic missile, it gains a +5 bonus to AC (including against the triggering attack) and immunity to magic missile. These benefits last until the start of its next turn.

reaction.name: Bite
reaction.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target that is grappled, incapacitated, restrained, willing, or unaware of the vampires presence. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage.
