legendary.name: Grab
legendary.text: The vampire makes a grab attack.

legendary.name: Mist Form
legendary.text: The vampire transforms into a mist or back into its true form. As mist, the vampire has a flying speed of 30, can't speak, can't take actions or manipulate objects, is immune to nonmagical damage from weapons, and has advantage on saving throws and Stealth checks. It can pass through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing but can't pass through water. Anything its carrying transforms with it.

legendary.name: Shapechange
legendary.text: The vampire transforms into the shape of a Medium or smaller beast or back into its true form. While transformed, it has the beasts size and movement modes. It can't use reactions or legendary actions, and can't speak. Otherwise, it uses the vampires statistics. Anything its carrying transforms with it.

monster.name: Vampire Spawn - a5e
monster.resist: necrotic; damage from nonmagical, non-silvered weapons
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and hasnt taken radiant damage since its last turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The vampire can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
trait.text: Vampires most common weaknesses are sunlight and running water. When the vampire ends its turn in contact with one of its weaknesses (such as being bathed in sunlight or running water), it takes 20 radiant damage. While in contact with its weakness, it can't use its Regeneration trait.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The vampire makes two attacks only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Grab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 14).

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target that is grappled incapacitated restrained or willing. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 14 (4d6) necrotic damage. The targets hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt and the vampire regains this number of hit points. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack it dies.

reaction.name: Hissing Scuttle (1/Day)
reaction.text: When the vampire takes radiant damage, it moves up to its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Vampire Warrior - a5e
monster.resist: necrotic; damage from nonmagical, non-silvered weapons
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
trait.text: When the vampire fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. When it does so, it visibly grows older. Its original appearance is restored when it finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Misty Recovery
trait.text: When the vampire drops to 0 hit points, instead of falling unconscious, it turns into mist as if it had used the Mist Form legendary action. It can't revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to vampire form and is paralyzed for 1 hour, at which time it regains 1 hit point. While paralyzed in this way, it can be destroyed by fire damage, radiant damage, damage from a magical weapon, or a wooden stake driven through the heart, but it is otherwise immune to damage.

trait.name: Regeneration
trait.text: The vampire regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and hasnt taken radiant damage since its last turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
trait.text: The vampire can climb even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
trait.text: Vampires most common weaknesses are sunlight and running water. When the vampire ends its turn in contact with one of its weaknesses (such as being bathed in sunlight or running water), it takes 20 radiant damage. While in contact with its weakness, it can't use its Regeneration trait or its Mist Form or Shapechange actions.

trait.name: Resting Place
trait.text: Every vampires lair contains a resting place, usually a coffin or sarcophagus, where the vampire must rest for at least an hour each day to recuperate its powers. This resting place is sprinkled with soil from its mortal homeland. If this soil is scattered or is subjected to a bless, hallow, or similar spell, the vampire is destroyed when reduced to 0 hit points.

action.name: Grab (Vampire Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 17) and restrained while grappled in this way.

action.name: Charm
action.text: The vampire targets a creature within 30 feet forcing it to make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the target is charmed by the vampire for 24 hours. While charmed it regards the vampire as a trusted friend and is a willing target for the vampires bite. The target repeats the saving throw each time it takes damage ending the effect on itself on a success. If the targets saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it it is immune to this vampires Charm for 24 hours.

action.name: Reaping Greatsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 10 ft. up to 3 targets. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature it makes a DC 17 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

reaction.name: Hissing Scuttle (1/Day)
reaction.text: When the vampire takes radiant damage, it moves up to its Speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

reaction.name: Warding Charm (1/Day)
reaction.text: When a creature the vampire can see targets it with a melee attack but before the attack is made, the vampire uses Charm on that creature.

reaction.name: Bite
reaction.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target that is grappled, incapacitated, restrained, willing, or unaware of the vampires presence. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 21 (6d6) necrotic damage. The targets hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and the vampire regains this number of hit points. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this attack, it dies and rises the following night as a vampire spawn in the vampires thrall. Before the target first rises as a vampire spawn, a bless, gentle repose, or similar spell cast on the body prevents this transformation.

legendary.name: The vampire can take 1 legendary action
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Blood Charm
legendary.text: The vampire uses Charm. A creature makes its initial saving throw with disadvantage if the vampire has hit it with a bite attack within the last 24 hours.

legendary.name: Grab
legendary.text: The vampire makes a grab attack.

legendary.name: Mist Form
legendary.text: The vampire transforms into a mist or back into its true form. As mist, the vampire has a flying speed of 30, can't speak, can't take actions or manipulate objects, is immune to nonmagical damage from weapons, and has advantage on saving throws and Stealth checks. It can pass through a space as narrow as 1 inch without squeezing but can't pass through water. Anything its carrying transforms with it.

legendary.name: Shapechange
legendary.text: The vampire transforms into the shape of a Medium or smaller beast or back into its true form. While transformed, it has the beasts size and movement modes. It can't use reactions or legendary actions, and can't speak. Otherwise, it uses the vampires statistics. Anything its carrying transforms with it.

monster.name: Vengeful Ghost - a5e
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, fatigue, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster.languages: the languages it spoke in life

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
trait.text: The ghost can see into both the Material and Ethereal Plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal
trait.text: The ghost can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A ghost doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Unquiet Spirit
trait.text: If defeated in combat, the ghost returns in 24 hours. It can be put to rest permanently only by finding and casting remove curse on its remains or by resolving the unfinished business that keeps it from journeying to the afterlife.

trait.name: Graveborn Strength
trait.text: When not in sunlight, creatures make their saving throws against the ghosts Horrifying Visage and Possession abilities with disadvantage.

action.name: Withering Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage. If the target is frightened it is magically aged 1d4 x 10 years. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt
action.text: The ghost magically shifts from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice versa. If it wishes it can be visible to creatures on one plane while on the other.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
action.text: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet and on the same plane of existence that can see the ghost makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure a creature is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creatures saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it it is immune to this ghosts Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

action.name: Possession (Recharge 6)
action.text: One humanoid within 5 feet makes a DC 13 Charisma saving throw. On a failure it is possessed by the ghost. The possessed creature is unconscious. The ghost enters the creatures body and takes control of it. The ghost can be targeted only by effects that turn undead and it retains its Intelligence Wisdom and Charisma. It grants its host body immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed creatures statistics and actions instead of its own. It doesnt gain access to the creatures memories but does gain access to proficiencies nonmagical class features and traits and nonmagical actions. It can't use limited-used abilities or class traits that require spending a resource. The possession ends after 24 hours when the body drops to 0 hit points when the ghost ends it as a bonus action or when the ghost is turned or affected by dispel evil and good or a similar effect. Additionally the possessed creature repeats its saving throw whenever it takes damage. When the possession ends the ghost reappears in a space within 5 feet of the body. A creature is immune to this ghosts Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on its saving throw or after the possession ends.

reaction.name: Horrifying Visage
reaction.text: If the ghost takes damage from an attack or spell, it uses Horrifying Visage.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The veteran makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit range 100/400 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Off-Hand Counter
reaction.text: When the veteran is missed by a melee attack by an attacker they can see within 5 feet, the veteran makes a shortsword attack against the attacker.

reaction.name: Tactical Movement
reaction.text: Until the end of the veterans turn, their Speed is halved and their movement doesnt provoke opportunity attacks.

monster.name: Violet Fungus - a5e
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, fatigue, frightened, prone, restrained, stunned
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 6

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, the violet fungus is indistinguishable from a normal fungus.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The fungus makes a rotting touch attack against two different creatures.

action.name: Rotting Touch
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit reach 15 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

monster.name: Vrock - a5e
monster.resist: cold, fire, lightning; damage from nonmagical weapons

trait.name: Chaotic Evil
trait.text: The vrock radiates a Chaotic and Evil aura.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
trait.text: The vrock has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The vrock attacks with its beak and its talons.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the vrock has advantage on the attack roll it deals an additional 7 (2d6) damage.

action.name: Talons
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Spores (1/Day)
action.text: A 15-foot-radius cloud of spores emanates from the vrock spreading around corners. Each creature in the area makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw becoming poisoned for 1 minute on a failure. While poisoned in this way the target takes ongoing 5 (1d10) poison damage. The target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
trait.text: The vulture has advantage on Perception checks that rely on sight and smell.

action.name: Beak
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Retreat
reaction.text: When the vulture would be hit by a melee attack, the vulture can move 5 feet away from the attacker. If this moves the vulture out of the attackers reach, the attacker has disadvantage on its attack.

monster.name: Walking Statue - a5e
monster.conditionImmune: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monster.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius), passive Perception 10

trait.name: Bludgeoning Weakness
trait.text: When the statue takes more than 10 bludgeoning damage from one attack, it falls prone.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While motionless, the statue is indistinguishable from a normal statue.

trait.name: Spell-created
trait.text: The DC for dispel magic to destroy this creature is 19.

action.name: Smash
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Luring Scent
trait.text: When a beast, humanoid or fey creature begins its turn within 30 feet, the creature makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it moves as close as it can to the wallflower and ends its turn. Creatures immune to being charmed are immune to this effect. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to the Luring Scent of all wallflowers for 24 hours.

action.name: Tentacles
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends the grick can't attack a different target with its tentacles.

trait.name: Aggressive Charge
trait.text: The eye moves up to their Speed towards an enemy they can see or hear.

trait.name: Warhordling Orc Eye Spellcasting
trait.text: The eye has advantage on attack rolls made against targets they can see with arcane eye.

trait.name: Spellcasting
trait.text: The priest is a 5th level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13 +5 to hit with spell attacks). They have the following cleric spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): guidance sacred flame thaumaturgy 1st-level (4 slots): ceremony detect evil and good guiding bolt bless 2nd-level (3 slots): lesser restoration arcane eye 3rd-level (2 slots): dispel magic spirit guardians

action.name: Mace
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage. On a hit the priest can expend a spell slot to deal 7 (2d6) radiant damage plus an extra 3 (1d6) radiant damage for each level of the spell slot expended above 1st.

action.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip; V, S)
action.text: One creature the priest can see within 60 feet makes a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw taking 9 (2d8) radiant damage on a failure. This spell ignores cover.

action.name: Guiding Bolt (1st-Level; V, S)
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit range 120 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (4d6) radiant damage and the next attack roll made against the target before the end of the priests next turn has advantage.

action.name: Dispel Magic (3rd-Level; V, S)
action.text: The priest scours the magic from one creature object or magical effect within 120 feet that they can see. A spell ends if it was cast with a 3rd-level or lower spell slot. For spells using a 4th-level or higher spell slot the priest makes a Wisdom ability check (DC 10 + the spells level) for each one ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Spirit Guardians (3rd-Level; V, S, M, Concentration)
action.text: Spectral forms surround the priest in a 10-foot radius for 10 minutes. The priest can choose creatures they can see to be unaffected by the spell. Other creatures treat the area as difficult terrain and when a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there it makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw taking 10 (3d6) radiant or necrotic damage (priests choice) on a failure or half damage on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The warrior attacks twice.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage. If the warrior has moved this turn this attack is made with advantage.

action.name: Greataxe
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d12 + 1) slashing damage.

action.name: Hooves
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d6+4) bludgeoning damage. If the horse moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack the target makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

monster.name: Warlords Ghost - a5e
monster.resist: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
monster.languages: the languages it spoke in life

trait.name: Death Howl
trait.text: When reduced to 0 hit points, the banshee uses Baleful Wail.

trait.name: Detect Life
trait.text: The banshee magically senses the general direction of living creatures up to 5 miles away.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
trait.text: The banshee can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A banshee doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Unquiet Spirit
trait.text: If defeated in combat, the banshee returns on the anniversary of its death. It can be permanently put to rest only by finding and casting remove curse on its grave or by righting whatever wrong was done to it.

action.name: Presage Death
action.text: The banshee targets a creature within 60 feet that can hear it predicting its doom. The target makes a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the target takes 11 (2d6 + 4) psychic damage and is magically cursed for 1 hour. While cursed in this way the target has disadvantage on saving throws against the banshees Baleful Wail.

action.name: Baleful Wail
action.text: The banshee shrieks. All living creatures within 30 feet of it that can hear it make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure a creature takes 11 (2d6 + 4) psychic damage. If the creature is cursed by the banshee it drops to 0 hit points instead.

reaction.name: Wounded Warning
reaction.text: When the banshee takes damage from a creature within 60 feet, it uses Presage Death on the attacker.

action.name: Spear
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage.

action.name: Warriors are combatants who fight in light armor
action.text: They excel in hit-and-run raids as opposed to pitched battles. Often warriors are not full-time soldiers. Among tribal and nomadic groups every able-bodied hunter or herder might be expected to fight in defense of the group. In agricultural societies farmers might band together in warrior militias.

trait.name: Area Vulnerability
trait.text: The band takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

trait.name: Band Dispersal
trait.text: When the band is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 2 (1d4) warriors with 5 hit points each.

trait.name: Band
trait.text: The band is composed of 5 or more warriors. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The band can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature without squeezing.

action.name: Spears
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. one target. Hit: 22 (5d6 + 5) piercing damage or half damage when bloodied.

action.name: Warriors who train together are able to fight as one, attacking and retreating as if they share a mind

monster.name: Water Elemental - a5e
monster.conditionImmune: fatigue, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious

trait.name: Conductive
trait.text: If the elemental takes lightning damage, each creature sharing its space takes the same amount of lightning damage.

trait.name: Fluid Form
trait.text: The elemental can enter and end its turn in other creatures spaces and move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Freeze
trait.text: If the elemental takes cold damage, its speed is reduced by 15 feet until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whelm
action.text: The elemental targets each Large or smaller creature in its space. Each target makes a DC 15 Strength saving throw. On a failure the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends the target is restrained and unable to breathe air. The elemental can move at full speed while carrying grappled creatures inside its space. It can grapple one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The weasel has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage. If this damage would reduce a Small or larger target to 0 hit points the target takes no damage from this attack.

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The werebear has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Wolfsbane
trait.text: Lycanthropes are repelled by the wolfsbane flower. A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried wolfsbane flower that it can smell. If wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were silver. An application of wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The werebear makes two claw attacks two greataxe attacks or two handaxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends the werebear can't use its greataxe and can't attack a different target with its claw.

action.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid it makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it is cursed with werebear lycanthropy.

trait.name: Relentless (1/Day)
trait.text: If the wereboar takes 14 or less damage that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is instead reduced to 1 hit point.

trait.name: Wolfsbane
trait.text: Lycanthropes are repelled by the wolfsbane flower. A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried wolfsbane flower that it can smell. If wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were silver. An application of wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: The wereboar makes two attacks only one of which can be with its tusks.

action.name: Maul (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tusks (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature it makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure. If the target is a humanoid it makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it is cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

monster.name: Wererat - a5e
monster.senses: darkvision 60 ft. (rat or hybrid form only), passive Perception 12

trait.name: Keen Smell
trait.text: The wererat has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wererat has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wererats allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

trait.name: Wolfsbane
trait.text: Lycanthropes are repelled by the wolfsbane flower. A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried wolfsbane flower that it can smell. If wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were silver. An application of wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Shortsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage or 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage if the attack is made with advantage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit range 30/120 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage or 12 (3d6 + 2) piercing damage if the attack is made with advantage.

action.name: Bite (Rat or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid it makes a DC 11 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it is cursed with wererat lycanthropy.

monster.name: Weretiger - a5e
monster.senses: darkvision 60 ft. (tiger or hybrid form only), passive Perception 15

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The weretiger has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Wolfsbane
trait.text: Lycanthropes are repelled by the wolfsbane flower. A lycanthrope in hybrid or beast form is poisoned while within 10 feet of a living or dried wolfsbane flower that it can smell. If wolfsbane is applied to a weapon or ammunition, lycanthropes are damaged by the weapon as if it were silver. An application of wolfsbane lasts for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: The weretiger makes two attacks neither of which can be a bite.

action.name: Longsword (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit range 150/600 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage. If the weretiger moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack the target makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

action.name: Bite (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid it makes a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it is cursed with weretiger lycanthropy.

monster.name: Werewolf - a5e
monster.senses: darkvision 30 ft. (wolf or hybrid form only), passive Perception 14

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The werewolf has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the werewolfs allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The werewolf makes two melee attacks only one of which can be with its bite.

action.name: Greatclub (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Claw (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid it makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw. On a failure it is cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

monster.name: White Dragon Wyrmling - a5e
monster.speed: 30 ft., Burrow: 15 ft., Fly: 60 ft., Swim: 30 ft.
monster.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 12

trait.name: Cold Mastery
trait.text: The dragons movement and vision is not hindered by cold, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the dragon can choose to burrow through snow and ice without leaving a trace.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d10 + 2) piercing damage.

action.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a 15-foot cone of frost. Each creature in that area makes a DC 12 Constitution saving throw taking 10 (3d6) cold damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

monster.name: Wight - a5e
monster.resist: cold, necrotic; damage from nonmagical, non-silvered weapons
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Cold Aura
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn grappled by the wight, touches it, or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet takes 3 (1d6) cold damage. A creature can take this damage only once per turn. If the wight has been subjected to fire damage since its last turn, this trait doesnt function.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A wight doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) slashing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

action.name: Seize
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 3 (1d6) cold damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends the target is restrained and the only attack the wight can make is Life Drain against the grappled target.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit range 150/600 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) cold damage.

monster.name: Will-o-Wisp - a5e
monster.resist: acid, cold, fire, necrotic, thunder; damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: fatigue, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Conductive
trait.text: Each time a creature touches the will-o-wisp or hits it with a metal melee weapon for the first time on a turn, the creature takes 7 (2d6) lightning damage. This trait doesnt function while the will-o-wisps glow is extinguished.

trait.name: Insubstantial
trait.text: The will-o-wisp can't pick up or move objects or creatures. It can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
trait.text: The will-o-wisp knows the location of coins, gems, and other nonmagical wealth within 500 feet.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A will-o-wisp doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

action.name: Shock
action.text: Melee Spell Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (3d6) lightning damage. The will-o-wisp can't make this attack while its glow is extinguished.

trait.name: Curse
trait.text: A creature that accepts a gift from the hag is magically cursed for 30 days. While it is cursed, the target automatically fails saving throws against the hags charm person, geas, and scrying spells, and the hag can cast control weather centered on the creature.

trait.name: Icy Travel
trait.text: The hag is not hindered by cold weather, icy surfaces, snow, wind, or storms. Additionally, the hag and her allies leave no trace when walking on snow or ice.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The hags innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: charm person, dancing lights, invisibility, minor illusion, passwall (ice only), 1/day: control weather (extreme cold), geas, scrying

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The hag attacks with its claws and uses Ice Bolt.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Ice Bolt
action.text: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit range 60 ft. one creature. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) cold damage and the target makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. A creature under the hags curse automatically fails this saving throw. On a failure the creature is restrained as it begins to turn to ice. At the end of the creatures next turn the creature repeats the saving throw. On a success the effect ends. On a failure the creature is petrified into ice. This petrification can be removed with greater restoration or similar magic.

action.name: Shapeshift
action.text: The hag magically polymorphs into a Small or Medium humanoid or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Equipment it is carrying isnt transformed. It retains a streak of white hair in any form. It returns to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Invisibility (2nd-Level; V, S, Concentration)
action.text: The hag is invisible for 1 hour. The spell ends if the hag attacks or casts a spell.

reaction.name: Ice Shield
reaction.text: The hag adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it made by a creature it can see. If the attack misses, the attacker takes 14 (4d6) cold damage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolfs allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

trait.name: Camouflage
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in snow.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it makes a DC 14 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

action.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The wolf exhales frost in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw taking 18 (4d8) cold damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
trait.text: The wolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the wolfs allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not incapacitated.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d6+2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it makes a DC 12 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The scout has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Shortsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit range 150/600 ft. one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

action.name: Wood elf scouts form the bulk of wood elf raiding parties and armies
action.text: When they can they fight from hiding sniping with their longbows.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
trait.text: The strider has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Trackless Travel
trait.text: The strider can't be tracked by nonmagical means.

trait.name: Trained Accuracy
trait.text: The striders weapon attacks deal an extra 7 (2d6) damage (included below).

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The strider attacks twice.

action.name: Longsword
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) damage.

action.name: Longbow
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit range 150/600 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (1d8+4) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) damage. This attack ignores half or three-quarters cover and long range doesnt impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
trait.text: The worg has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and smell.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d6+2) piercing damage. If the target is a creature it makes a DC 13 Strength saving throw falling prone on a failure.

monster.name: Wraith - a5e
monster.resist: acid, cold, lightning, thunder; damage from nonmagical, non-silvered weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, fatigue, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aura of Fear
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of a wraith makes a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creatures saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to any wraiths Aura of Fear for 24 hours.

trait.name: Evil
trait.text: The wraith radiates an Evil aura.

trait.name: Incorporeal
trait.text: The wraith can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. If it takes radiant damage, it loses this trait until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight or bright light cast by a fire, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A wraith doesnt require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: The wraith targets a creature within 5 feet forcing it to make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 14 (4d6) necrotic damage or 21 (6d6) necrotic damage if it is frightened or surprised and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. It dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Create Specter
action.text: The wraith touches a humanoid corpse it killed less than 1 day ago. The creatures spirit rises as a specter under the wraiths control.

monster.name: Wraith Lord - a5e
monster.resist: acid, lightning, psychic, thunder; damage from nonmagical weapons
monster.conditionImmune: charmed, fatigue, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, unconscious
monster.languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Aura of Fear
trait.text: A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of a wraith lord makes a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is frightened until the start of its next turn. If a creatures saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it is immune to any wraith or wraith lords Aura of Fear for 24 hours.

trait.name: Evil
trait.text: The wraith lord radiates an Evil aura.

trait.name: Incorporeal
trait.text: The wraith lord can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. If it takes radiant damage, it loses this trait until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Light Sensitivity
trait.text: While in sunlight or bright light cast by a fire, the wraith lord has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Perception checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A wraith doesnt require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wraith lord can use Paralyzing Terror. It then uses Life Drain twice. If in corporeal form it then makes a greatsword attack.

action.name: Life Drain
action.text: The wraith targets a creature within 5 feet forcing it to make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 17 (5d6) necrotic damage or 24 (7d6) necrotic damage if it is frightened or surprised and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. It dies if its hit point maximum is reduced to 0.

action.name: Greatsword (Corporeal Form Only)
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage plus 17 (5d6) poison damage and the target makes a DC 18 Constitution saving throw. On a failure the target is poisoned for 24 hours. While poisoned in this way the target can't regain hit points. If a creature dies while poisoned in this way its spirit rises as a wraith under the wraith lords control 1 minute after its death.

action.name: Paralyzing Terror
action.text: The wraith lord targets a frightened creature within 60 feet forcing it to make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the target is paralyzed for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Create Wraith
action.text: The wraith lord touches a humanoid corpse it killed up to 1 day ago. The creatures spirit rises as a wraith under the wraith lords control.

action.name: Corporeal Form (1/Day)
action.text: The wraith lord takes on a material form. In material form it loses its incorporeal trait its fly speed and its immunity to the grappled prone and restrained conditions. The wraith instantly reverts to its incorporeal form if it is bloodied and it can do so voluntarily at any time as an action.

trait.name: Imperfect Flight
trait.text: While bloodied, the wyverns fly speed is halved, and it can't gain altitude.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The wyvern attacks once with its bite and once with its stinger. While flying it can use its claws in place of one other attack.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage. If the wyvern is attacking from above the target is grappled by the wyvern (escape DC 15). While grappling a target in this way the wyverns Speed is reduced to 0 it can't use its claws to attack any other creature and it has advantage on attacks against the target.

action.name: Stinger
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 10 ft. one creature. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage. The target makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

monster.name: Xorn - a5e
monster.resist: acid; damage from nonmagical, non-adamantine weapons
monster.senses: darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 16

trait.name: Camouflage
trait.text: The xorn has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

trait.name: Earth Glide
trait.text: The xorn can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

trait.name: Treasure Sense
trait.text: The xorn can locate by smell coins and gems within 500 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The xorn makes three claw attacks and then makes a bite attack if it can.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one creature that was hit by the xorns claws at least twice this turn. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) piercing damage and the xorn consumes one of the following nonmagical objects in the targets possession: a worn set of metal armor or a carried metal weapon or shield a piece of metal equipment a gem or up to 1 000 coins. For 1 minute after an item is consumed a creature can retrieve it from the gullet of a willing incapacitated or dead xorn taking 7 (2d6) acid damage in the process.

trait.name: Camouflage
trait.text: The yeti has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

trait.name: Fire Fear
trait.text: When the yeti takes fire damage, it is rattled until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Storm Sight
trait.text: The yetis vision is not obscured by weather conditions.

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The yeti uses Chilling Gaze and makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 9 (2d4 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Chilling Gaze (Gaze)
action.text: One creature within 30 feet that is not immune to cold damage makes a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 10 (3d6) cold damage and is paralyzed for 1 minute. It repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on a success. If a creatures saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it it is immune to any Chilling Gaze for 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Eater
trait.text: Yobbos figure all magic works the sameway that magic potions do. As such, they devour spellcomponents, spell scrolls, and magical trinketsalikewhen they are made aware of them. Yobbos instinctivelyknow which creatures have magic items onthem. When they successfully grab a creature, theyuse their next action to take that creatures nearestmagic item and then stuff it down their throats. Ifit is a weapon, it deals damage to them as if theydbeen hit by that weapon. If its a piece of armor, theirmouths stretch to fit around it. They are now imbuedwith the powers of the devoured magic item.

trait.name: Explosive Death
trait.text: When a yobbo is reduced to 0 hitpoints, its body explodes and releases a random1st-level spell. This spell targets the creature nearestto the yobbos corpse.

action.name: Mangler
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage. A natural 20 scored with thisweapon mangles the targets hand rendering it useless until the targets next long rest. A natural 1 scored with thisweapon does the same but to the yobbo.

action.name: Spike ball
action.text: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit range 30/90 ft. one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Young Amethyst Dragon - a5e
monster.languages: Common, Deep Speech, Draconic, Undercommon, telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Far Thoughts
trait.text: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 19). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:calm emotions, charm person

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks once with its bite and twice with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) force damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage.

action.name: Concussive Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon psionically unleashes telekinetic energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw taking 44 (8d10) force damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

monster.name: Young Black Dragon - a5e
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 18

trait.name: Ambusher
trait.text: When submerged in water, the dragon has advantage on Stealth checks. If the dragon hits a creature that can't see it with its bite, it can deal piercing damage and grapple the target simultaneously.

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Ruthless (1/Round)
trait.text: After scoring a critical hit on its turn, the dragon can immediately make one claw attack.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:fog cloud, pass without trace

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks once with its bite and twice with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage. Instead of dealing piercing damage the dragon can grapple the target (escape DC 16) and a Medium or smaller creature grappled in this way is restrained. While grappling a creature the dragon can't bite another creature.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales sizzling acid in a 40-foot-long 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw taking 45 (10d8) acid damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. A creature that fails the save is blinded until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Young Blue Dragon - a5e
monster.speed: 40 ft., Burrow: 20 ft., Fly: 80 ft., Swim: 20 ft.
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft., tremorsense 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 18

trait.name: Desert Farer
trait.text: The dragon ignores difficult terrain or obscurement caused by sand or gravel, even while flying. Additionally, it ignores the effects of extreme heat.

trait.name: Dune Splitter
trait.text: The dragon can remain submerged in sand and gravel for up to 4 hours. It has advantage on Stealth checks to hide in this way.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:blur, silent image

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks once with its bite and twice with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

action.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a 60-foot-long 5-foot-wide line of lightning. Each creature in that area makes a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw taking 44 (8d10) lightning damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. A creature that fails the save can't take reactions until the end of its next turn.

monster.name: Young Brass Dragon - a5e
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 18

trait.name: Self-Sufficient
trait.text: The brass dragon can subsist on only a quart of water and a pound of food per day.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:comprehend languages,

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks with its bite and twice with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) fire damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

action.name: Molten Breath
action.text: The dragon exhales molten glass in a 40-foot-long 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw taking 38 (11d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

action.name: Sleep Breath
action.text: The dragon exhales sleep gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failure a creature falls unconscious for 10 minutes or until it takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

monster.name: Young Bronze Dragon - a5e
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 18

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Oracle of the Coast
trait.text: The dragon can accurately predict the weather up to 7 days in advance and is never considered surprised while conscious.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:fog cloud, speak with animals

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks with its bite and twice with its claws. In place of its bite it can use Lightning Pulse.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 23 (3d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) lightning damage.

action.name: Claw
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 15 ft. one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) bludgeoning damage and the dragon pushes the target 10 feet away.

action.name: Trident (Humanoid Form Only)
action.text: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +13 to hit reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft. one target. Hit: 10 (1d6 + 7) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Pulse
action.text: The dragon targets one creature within 60 feet forcing it to make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. The creature takes 22 (4d10) lightning damage on a failure or half damage on a success. If the initial target is touching a body of water all other creatures within 20 feet of it and touching the same body of water must also make the saving throw against this damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

action.name: Lightning Breath
action.text: The dragon exhales lightning in a 90-foot-long 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in the area makes a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw taking 69 (13d10) lightning damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. A creature that fails the saving throw can't take reactions until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ocean Surge
action.text: The dragon exhales a torrent of seawater in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 20 Strength saving throw. A creature that fails is pushed 30 feet away from the dragon and knocked prone while one that succeeds is pushed only 15 feet away.

action.name: Change Shape
action.text: The dragon magically takes the shape of a humanoid or beast or changes back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (dragons choice). In the new form the dragons stats are unchanged except for its size. It can't use Lightning Pulse Breath Weapons Tail Attack or Wing Attack except in dragon form. In beast form it can attack only with its bite and claws if appropriate to its form. If the beast form is Large or smaller the reach of these attacks is reduced to 5 feet. In humanoid form it can attack only with its trident.

reaction.name: Tail Attack
reaction.text: When a creature the dragon can see within 10 feet hits the dragon with a melee attack, the dragon makes a tail attack against it.

legendary.name: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions
legendary.text: Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creatures turn. It regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Roar
legendary.text: Each creature of the dragons choice within 120 feet that can hear it makes a DC 18 Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it is frightened for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. When it succeeds on a saving throw or the effect ends for it, it is immune to Roar for 24 hours.

legendary.name: Wing Attack
legendary.text: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet makes a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed 10 feet away and knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its fly speed.

legendary.name: Foresight (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary.text: The dragon focuses on the many sprawling futures before it and predicts what will come next. Attacks against it are made with disadvantage until the start of its next turn.

monster.name: Young Copper Dragon - a5e
monster.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 120 ft., passive Perception 15

trait.name: Flow Within the Mountain
trait.text: The dragon has advantage on Stealth checks made to hide in mountainous regions.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:hideous laughter, suggestion

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks with its bite and twice with its claws.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 15 (3d10 + 4) piercing damage plus 4 (1d8) acid damage.

action.name: Claws
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

action.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons:

action.name: Acid Breath
action.text: The dragon exhales acid in a 40-foot-long 5-foot wide-line. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw taking 45 (10d8) acid damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

action.name: Slowing Breath
action.text: The dragon exhales toxic gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw becoming slowed for 1 minute on a failure. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

monster.name: Young Earth Dragon - a5e
monster.senses: darkvision 120 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 20

trait.name: Earth Glide
trait.text: The dragon can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone without disturbing it.

trait.name: False Appearance
trait.text: While the dragon remains motionless within its linked area, it is indistinguishable from a natural rocky outcropping.

trait.name: Essence Link
trait.text: The essence dragon is spiritually linked to a specific area or landmark. The dragon gains no benefit from a long rest when more than 1 mile away from its linked area. If the dragon dies, the area it is linked to loses its vital essence until it forms a new essence dragon, which can take centuries. When a creature first enters an area that has lost its vital essence in this way, they gain a level of fatigue and a level of strife. This fatigue and strife can be removed only by completing a long rest outside the area.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 12). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:locate animals or plants, spike growth

action.name: Multiattack
action.text: The dragon attacks once with its bite and twice with its slam.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 10 ft. one target. Hit: 22 (4d10 + 4) piercing damage.

action.name: Slam
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Scouring Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales scouring sand and stones in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw taking 38 (11d6) slashing damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

monster.name: Young Emerald Dragon - a5e
monster.languages: Common, Deep Speech, Draconic, Undercommon, telepathy 120 ft.

trait.name: Far Thoughts
trait.text: The dragon is aware of any creature that uses a psionic ability or communicates telepathically within 100 miles of it. As an action, the dragon can psionically observe a creature, object, or location it is familiar with within 100 miles. While observing a subject in this way, the dragon can see, hear, and communicate telepathically, but it is blind and deaf in regard to its physical senses and does not require food or water. The dragon can psionically observe a subject indefinitely and can end this effect and return to its own senses as an action.

trait.name: Innate Spellcasting
trait.text: The dragons spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 15). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components. 3/day each:hideous laughter, suggestion

action.name: Maddening Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon screams stripping flesh from bone in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw taking 44 (8d10) thunder damage on a failed save or half damage on a success.

action.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
action.text: The dragon exhales a blast of fire that fills a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw taking 52 (15d6) fire damage on a failed save or half damage on a success. A creature that fails the saving throw also takes 5 (1d10) ongoing fire damage. While affected by this ongoing damage it is frightened of the dragon. A creature can use an action to end the ongoing damage.

monster.name: Zombie - a5e
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude (1/Day)
trait.text: If the zombie is reduced to 0 hit points by damage that isnt radiant or from a critical hit, its instead reduced to 1 hit point, falls prone, and is stunned until the end of its next turn, appearing to be dead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A zombie doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

action.name: Grab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is grappled (escape DC 11). Until the grapple ends the zombie can't grab another target.

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one grappled target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) piercing damage and the zombie regains the same number of hit points.

monster.name: Zombie Horde - a5e
monster.languages: understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Area Vulnerability
trait.text: The horde takes double damage from any effect that targets an area.

trait.name: Horde
trait.text: The horde is composed of 5 or more zombies. If it is subjected to a spell, attack, or other effect that affects only one target, it takes any damage but ignores other effects. It can share its space with Medium or smaller creatures or objects. The horde can move through any opening large enough for one Medium creature without squeezing.

trait.name: Horde Dispersal
trait.text: When the horde is reduced to 0 hit points, it turns into 2 (1d4) zombies with 7 hit points each.

trait.name: Undead Nature
trait.text: A zombie doesnt require air, sustenance, or sleep.

action.name: Grab
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one target. Hit: 22 (5d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature it is grappled (escape DC 11).

action.name: Bite
action.text: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit reach 5 ft. one grappled target. Hit: 32 (5d10 + 5) piercing damage and the horde regains the same number of hit points.
